meanings.definition: An overthrow or repudiation and the thorough replacement of an established government or political system by the people governed.
meanings.sent1: The people's revolution led to a new government being formed.
meanings.sent2: The industrial revolution brought significant changes to society.
meanings.sent3: It was a revolution of sorts when the cafeteria started serving pizza every day.
meanings.sent4: Her idea sparked a revolution in the way we approach problem-solving.
meanings.sent5: The revolution in technology made communication faster and easier.

meanings.definition: A sudden, complete, or marked change in something.
meanings.sent1: The sudden revolution in fashion caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The revolution in the weather turned a sunny day into a stormy one.
meanings.sent3: It was a revolution of flavors when she added cinnamon to the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The revolution in his attitude towards work was remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The revolution in the music industry brought new genres to the forefront.
